sentence.Network_en: She burned with an incandescence that had nothing to do with her looks.
sentence.Network_cn: 她光彩照人，却与容貌无关。

sentence.Network_en: A fine wire is heated electrically to incandescence in an electric lamp.
sentence.Network_cn: 灯丝在电灯中电加时成白炽状态。

sentence.Network_en: A fine wire heated electrically to incandescence in an electric lamp.
sentence.Network_cn: 电灯光亮来自白热的灯丝.

entry.def: Incandescent substances or devices give out a lot of light when heated.

entry.tran: 活力四射的;热情洋溢的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as incandescent, you mean that they are very lively and impressive.

example.ex: Gill had an extraordinary, incandescent personality.
example.tran: 吉尔个性鲜明，热情洋溢。
杰茜·诺曼活力四射的演出

entry.def: If you say that someone is incandescent with rage, you mean that they are extremely angry.

example.ex: It makes me incandescent with fury.

means.word_mean: 1. the phenomenon of light emission by a body as its temperature is raised

auth_sentence.content: The incandescence of his fever had dimmed.
auth_sentence.res_content: The incandescence of his fever had dimmed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The incandescence of his fever had dimmed.

auth_sentence.content: Now she sounded listless, flat, all the incandescence of fury gone.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now she sounded listless, flat, all the incandescence of fury gone.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now she sounded listless, flat, all the incandescence of fury gone.
